answers.author: Robert Ranc
answers.text:
Ogden City, which I worked for in Economic Development before moving to Lehi City, has a nationally-recognized public-private partnership called "Business Depot Ogden (BDO)."  Follow the link for an article that was published in the "Economic Development Journal" by Tom Christopulos, Ogden's Director of Community and Economic Development. http://www.ogdenbusiness.com/about-us/ogden-business-news/item/2375-edj-economic-catalyst-for-community-transformation-by-tom-christopulos.html


Ogden City, which I worked for in Economic Development before moving to Lehi City, has a nationally-recognized public-private partnership called "Business Depot Ogden (BDO)."  Follow the link for an article that was published in the "Economic Development Journal" by Tom Christopulos, Ogden's Director of Community and Economic Development. http://www.ogdenbusiness.com/about-us/ogden-business-news/item/2375-edj-economic-catalyst-for-community-transformation-by-tom-christopulos.html

answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hi Karen, 
Thank you for your question on public-private partnerships, unfortunately I do not know of any reports which list the number of public-private partnerships. However, ICMA has many great articles about such partnerships and I have attached a few of those below. In addition you can always check out the public-private partnerships topic page for the most recent information and can visit the documents and articles section to see recent case studies. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/222/PublicPrivate_Partnerships
•   Here is a case study from the City of Roswell on how through public-private service delivery they were able to improve their level of services and increase efficiency. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/305002/Contract_Provider_Increases_Efficiences_Decreases_Complaints_and_Generates_Compliments_in_the_City_o
•   Here is a case study about the City of Dubuque and how they have utilized public-private partnerships to increase sustainability in their community. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/305164/Dubuque_Gets_Engaged__The_Critical_Role_of_Partnerships_in__Moving_Sustainability_Forward
•   Best, 
Robin Saywitz
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Karen Walz-Fuentes
text: We are looking for any studies, reports or information about the number/listing of offices or programs supporting public private partnerships.   We are looking to update/add on to the existing “database” that we are developing and tracking.
title: Information needed on offices that support public private partnerships
